Exaggerate: The claim in the audio clip exaggerates the number of Covid-19 positive cases in Nagpur, stating that 59 people have tested positive, while the official data confirms only five cases.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that a team from Sweden is coming to Nagpur to conduct Covid-19 tests. The district information officer confirmed that this claim is fabricated.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is solely based on an audio clip circulating on WhatsApp, without any credible sources or evidence.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the doctors in Nagpur lack the capacity and knowledge to conduct Covid-19 tests, which is a problematic assumption without any substantial evidence.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by providing inaccurate information about the number of positive cases and the involvement of a Swedish team.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the audio clip was created and circulated to spread false information and create panic.
